record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 11, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 11, 2007 -- (Senate - September 10, 2007)

[Page: S11353]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m. tomorrow morning, September 11; that on tomorrow, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 3074, the Transportation Appropriations Act; that the Senate stand in recess from 12:30 to 2:15 p.m. to accommodate the respective party conferences; further, that on Tuesday, in commemoration of the sixth anniversary of the September 11 attack, the Senate observe a moment of silence at 12 noon.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
